meanings.definition: Accepting or allowing what happens or what others do, without active response or resistance.
meanings.sent1: She had a passive attitude towards the changes at work.
meanings.sent2: The passive observer watched the birds in the park.
meanings.sent3: The passive cat let the dog steal its toy without a fuss.
meanings.sent4: The old house stood passive as the storm raged outside.
meanings.sent5: The passive student never raised their hand in class.

meanings.definition: Showing that the subject of the sentence is being acted upon.
meanings.sent1: The passive voice is used in this sentence.
meanings.sent2: The passive recipient of the award was thrilled.
meanings.sent3: The passive cookie was eaten by the hungry child.
meanings.sent4: The passive clouds drifted lazily across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The passive kitten was cuddled by the little girl.

meanings.definition: Inactive or not participating in an activity.
meanings.sent1: The passive player sat on the bench during the game.
meanings.sent2: The passive audience quietly watched the performance.
meanings.sent3: The passive phone lay forgotten on the table.
meanings.sent4: The passive river flowed gently through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The passive plant wilted without water.
